The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023090093
item.description:
Report E-2023090093

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-02
  • City: SCHENECTADY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 8/02/2023 an employee at Veolia's Schenectady, NY 10 day intransit facility was loading drums from a trailer into another trailer when the employee scratched the side of a 55-gallon steel drum with the drum cart while placing it in an outbound trailer. The leak occurred when the employee was moving the drums into the trailer and the employee misjudged the clearance to another drum. The 55 gallon drum containing flammable corrosive liquids was scraped with a drum cart which resulted in causing a leak from the drum. Approximately one pint of liquid leaked out of the impacted drum. Liquid was only observed on trailer right below drum and did not leak out of the vehicle. The drum was overpacked into an 85 gallon salvage drum, the spill cleaned up, and transportation to the ultimate disposal facility was continued. The liquid was cleaned up with spill pads and absorbent material. The duration of release is anticipated to be less than 1 minute as the employee immediately noticed the accident and began taking measures to contain the spill.

item.title: Report X-2023081196
item.description:
Report X-2023081196

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-14
  • City: BINGHAMTON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Q.A. was called to the unload to retrieve a damaged wet package from the belly of a trailer. upon further investigation it was realized that it was a hazmat that had bursted open. Q.A. took the leaking hazmat to the cage to be repacked and processed. DescribePack: hazmat had 2 bottles one had a loose cap. one bottle was completely empty soaking the box. closure points were open DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the package was taken from the unload and put in a tote to be transported to the cage to be evaluated and repacked.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit due to improper blocking and bracing and that one of the large 2000 pound forklift battery(2794) had fallen over and released 1 gallon of acid. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was carried onto van line 100 and a leakage was noticed by a manager and immediately was placed in a hazmat bin by a manager and away from work area. DescribePack: There was a small puncture in the blue cap bottle of rapicide a as well as a loose cap on the second container of rapicide a. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately was placed in a hazmat bin by a manager and away from work area.

DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Managers put it in the bin and move it away as far away from package handlers as possible.
